cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 30 mi (45 km) SSE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north-northeast, cross the eastern Gulf of Mexico, intensify into a hurricane, make landfall in Florida’s Big Bend, then sweep northeast across southern Georgia and the coastal Carolinas before moving back offshore.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend region (near Cedar Key)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Big Bend west coast, extending inland across southern Georgia and the entire Georgia–South Carolina coastline
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Possible (2-4 ft surge possible along southeast GA coast)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35-45 kt gusts) possible late Wed into Wed night
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor to moderate coastal inundation of 2–4 ft possible with onshore flow as center passes inland
weather_observation.rainfall: 3-6 inches with isolated 8-10 inches possible, causing flash and urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and squalls could impact port operations during outer rainbands
